Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tranexamic Acid in Reducing Blood Loss During Nephrectomy for Wilms Tumor in Children

Trial_Design.evidence: This prospective, randomised controlled trial was conducted at a tertiary healthcare center in India.

Participants.evidence: Sixty children under 10 years with Wilms tumor scheduled for elective nephrectomy

Intervention.evidence: TXA group (n=30) received 50 mg/kg TXA intravenously, followed by 5 mg/kg/h infusion; NS group (n=30) received an equivalent volume of normal saline.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the efficacy of tranexamic acid (TXA) in reducing blood loss during this procedure in children.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was intraoperative blood loss, measured during surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Both patients and outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Sixty children under 10 years with Wilms tumor scheduled for elective nephrectomy were randomised into two groups

Result_Outcome.evidence: The TXA group had significantly lower intraoperative blood loss (216.33 mL vs 306.33 mL; p=0.001) and PRBC transfusion volume (167.0 mL vs 199.8 mL; p=0.045).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group during the intraoperative or immediate postoperative period.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration: Clinical Trial Registry of India (No. 2024/09/073921).
